data: q1h for 4 hours, then q1h for 2 hours then as per unit routine or provider orders
q1h for 12 hours, then q4h thereafter
Notify provider or Nurse Practioner if any significant changes
Notify provider / NP of sanguinous drainage over _____ mL/h or serous drainage over _____ mL/h
Site: Chest, Dressing type: Mepore, Change dressing q2day, and PRN if soiled

Chest Tube Number 1, Location Right, Type Pigtail drainage catheter, Suction: Gravity, Device Chest tube bulb, Special Instructions: Blake Chest Tube. Strip drain tubing q1h for first 12 hours then q2h thereafter and PRN

Chest Tube Number 1, Location Right, Type Pigtail drainage catheter, Suction: Gravity, Device Chest tube valve, Heimlich, Special Instructions: Blake Chest Tube. Strip drain tubing q1h for first 12 hours then q2h thereafter and PRN

Chest Tube Number 1, Location Pleural | Left, Type Pigtail drainage catheter, Suction: Gravity, Device Chest tube bulb, Special Instructions: Blake Chest Tube. Strip drain tubing q1h for first 12 hours then q2h thereafter and PRN

Chest Tube Number 1, Location Left, Type Pigtail drainage catheter, Suction: Gravity, Device Chest tube valve, Heimlich, Special Instructions: Blake Chest Tube. Strip drain tubing q1h for first 12 hours then q2h thereafter and PRN

Only clamp tubing for a short period of time when changing drains, checking for air leaks, accidental disconnection, when moving collection chamber above chest height, or when ordered in preparation for discontinuation. Use non-toothed clamps
Start: Adjust/Advance Diet to: General Diet, Provider must order starting diet.  RN or RD to place subsequent diet orders
Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 92% or greater
